title: Anyone else have Linux that might be able to lend a hand?
body:
I got an email back from a Riot employee telling me that they couldn't help me and that I should look to other people, so here I am. Gracious as I am for a response from this very busy team, the result wasn't what I was looking for. If anyone was/is experiencing the same problem and found out how to fix it, I would appreciate if you could tell me how I could fix my issue. No one in my family is really computer smart and I had to rely on Youtube videos to even manage to have league accessible to me, and we all know how many Linux help guides there are out there for specific cases like mine... Not many I know. Here's my previous post: 

Hello Everyone, I hope you're all having good luck with solving the trouble you have found with the patch and your launchers!

I'm here to ask for help regarding the new patch as I cannot get onto league any longer. Yesterday it was working fine, but today (I assume because of the new patch), I cannot seem to even open the launcher. Unfortunately... I have been "blessed" with having Linux as my operating system. Numerous difficulties have already been sought out when trying to first download League months ago when I first started. Because of my circumstance and the rare amount of Linux league players that I know (none). I find myself in a pickle that I cannot solve myself no matter how hard I try to fiddle with buttons as I am not very computer smart. The Linux Ubuntu Launcher I use is "PlayonLinux" found in the Software Center. It's strange but, it's still a godsend as it's my only way to play League. https://www.playonlinux.com/en/app-1135.html This is a link to the launcher's website. As you can see there is other people looking for a fix to this problem, but none of them have been answered. If there's anyone that has any answer to this I'd be appreciative of the help. I have not been playing very long but, am itching to get back online with my friends and get back to learning {{champion:136}}  and {{champion:412}} 

Ubuntu 14.04
And I still have plenty of space on my memory.

I have uninstalled League on this Launcher but when attempting to re-download it; I was met with this message:

"PlayOnLinux has encountered a fatal error. PlayOnLinux will stop the installation process. Visit www.playonlinux.com to get further information"

I'm still looking through this site, but will take any help I can. Thank you for reading.

Have a great week everyone and if you have any tips please feel free to post, losing hope that I'll get back to playing league and my {{champion:136}}

replies.body: My uncle who has a profession in programming came over to see what the problem was with my league launcher. So he fixed the launcher. BUT When the download got to a point it ended in a bug splat. Does anyone who use's league on Linux know how to fix this in dummy/baby steps?

Check out this topic and try out what works for you: https://www.playonlinux.com/en/app-1135-League_Of_Legends.html

I'm running ubuntu 14.04 with Intel HD graphics. I got constant crashes until I upgraded playonlinux & wine (directly download the latest versions from their website). I'm currently using Wine version 1.9.2-staging-LOL3 with CSMT enabled in the Wine config. It works fine now although for me I get a random 1-20 second freeze every 10 minutes which is really annoying.

Update: I just switched to 1.9.20-staging and it seems to be working well now!

> [{quoted}](name=Kluuru,realm=EUW,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=WcnHzyGN,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-10-27T15:52:25.500+0000)
>
> Check out this topic and try out what works for you: https://www.playonlinux.com/en/app-1135-League_Of_Legends.html
> 
> I'm running ubuntu 14.04 with Intel HD graphics. I got constant crashes until I upgraded playonlinux & wine (directly download the latest versions from their website). I'm currently using Wine version 1.9.2-staging-LOL3 with CSMT enabled in the Wine config. It works fine now although for me I get a random 1-20 second freeze every 10 minutes which is really annoying.
> 
> Update: I just switched to 1.9.20-staging and it seems to be working well now!

I understand that I need to update things and after a week and a few days of searching I still can't understand what I'm actually suppose to do. I know I need to update wine and PlayonLinux, but I am not computer smart and I don't understand the terms used by other Linux users.

I personally think Linux is a blessing, and I hope one day, more gamers choose to use it as their primary operating system. Unfortunately, I'm unable to assist you in troubleshooting this, as we don't have [official support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752654-Minimum-and-Recommended-System-Requirements/) for Linux.
___
In this instance, it kinda sounds like the issue is more of a configuration or problem from the PlayOnLinux side rather that directly with the League client. I strongly encourage you to hit up the [PlayOnLinux Forums](https://www.playonlinux.com/en/forums.html) for additional assistance with this.

If you have any further questions, please let me know. Best of luck in resolving this, fellow Linux friend. ^.^
